author: Anonymous Comp
title: PSET 8 Q7 Clarification
question:
Hi, is this a mistake in the problem description for PSET 8 problem 7?
(@problem 7)
;;
;; Design a function called more-than-n. more-than-n takes two arguments: a
;; Treasure (t) and a Natural (n) IN THAT ORDER. It produces a list of the label
;; names of treasures that contain an amount of gold larger than n. For this 
;; question, assume that the amount of gold in each box is magically multiplied
;; based on the status of the treasure box.
Are the treasures being compared against n only the treasures that the given treasure (t) leads to? Or is this function supposed to consume a ListOfTreasure instead?
student_answer: Review the data definition for Treasure again. What type of data can its selectors be?
